title.value: SPEECH EMOTION DIARIZATION: WHICH EMOTION APPEARS WHEN?
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper.
title.quote: SPEECH EMOTION DIARIZATION: WHICH EMOTION APPEARS WHEN?

extractions.description: This paper introduces the concept of Speech Emotion Diarization (SED), aiming to identify both the emotions conveyed in speech and their temporal boundaries. It proposes a new evaluation metric, the Emotion Diarization Error Rate (EDER), and introduces the Zaion Emotion Dataset (ZED), designed for fine-grained emotion recognition.

type.justification: The paper proposes a new task (Speech Emotion Diarization), a new dataset (Zaion Emotion Dataset), and provides evaluation results using baseline models on this task.
type.quote: In summary, our work brings the following contributions to the field of fine-grained speech emotion recognition...

name.justification: The dataset is introduced and used for evaluation in the paper.
name.quote: To facilitate the evaluation of the performance and establish a common benchmark, we introduce the Zaion Emotion Dataset (ZED), an openly accessible speech emotion dataset that includes non-acted emotions recorded in real-life conditions, along with manually annotated boundaries of emotion segments within the utterance.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Zaion Emotion Dataset is a novel contribution of this paper, not referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The ZED dataset includes discrete categorical labels for emotional segments within each utterance, as well as manually annotated boundaries for each emotion segment.
